page.title: 07WEBB CRYSTAL WORKS,AMBLECOTE
page.content: The impressive eighteenth century mansion,{Dennis Hall,}has been the home of{Thomas Webb Crystal}since 1855. Today it is still an excellent example of one of the world famous lead crystal works to be found in the{ {Black Country.}It also provides an opportunity to witness at first hand glass making techniques little changed for almost 150 years. A workforce of about 250 work a seven hour shift. On tours of the factory one sees how glass is produced; the teams of four or five men shaping molten glass, the finishing off processes and delicate cutting and engraving techniques. A museum housed in the mansion traces the history of glass making in the area and taking pride of place in the entrance hall is a beautiful chandelier dating back to 1878.
